title: J05-4003

sentences.text: We present a novel method for discovering parallel sentences in comparable , non-parallel corpora .
We train a maximum entropy classifier that , given a pair of sentences , can reliably determine whether or not they are translations of each other .
Using this approach , we extract parallel data from large Chinese , Arabic , and English non-parallel newspaper corpora .
We evaluate the quality of the extracted data by showing that it improves the performance of a state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system .
We also show that a good-quality MT system can be built from scratch by starting with a very small parallel corpus -LRB- 100,000 words -RRB- and exploiting a large non-parallel corpus .
Thus , our method can be applied with great benefit to language pairs for which only scarce resources are available .

kg2text: The method extracts parallel data from large Chinese, Arabic, and English non-parallel newspaper corpora, which it utilizes to discover parallel sentences. This method is specifically designed for discovering parallel sentences and is applied to comparable, non-parallel corpora. By employing a maximum entropy classifier, the method analyzes pairs of sentences to determine if they are translations of each other. Additionally, the method can be applied with great benefit to various language pairs, enhancing the extraction of parallel sentences from non-parallel corpora. Overall, the method plays a crucial role in the identification and extraction of parallel sentences, contributing significantly to the development of good-quality machine translation systems.

The maximum entropy classifier can determine translations of each other, which are pairs of sentences conveying the same meaning in different languages. A good-quality MT system can be built from various sources, including a small parallel corpus, a very small parallel corpus, and a general parallel corpus. Additionally, it exploits a large non-parallel corpus to enhance its capabilities. Parallel sentences, which are translations of each other, fall under the broader category of sentences. The statistical machine translation system is a type of MT system, with the state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system being a more advanced version. The performance of a state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system is a broader term that encompasses overall performance metrics. Extracted data plays a crucial role in improving performance, while the quality of the extracted data directly enhances the performance of a state-of-the-art statistical machine translation system. Language pairs, essential for translation tasks, are often available with scarce resources, which are a broader category of resources necessary for effective machine translation. Furthermore, extracted data is evaluated to assess the quality of the extracted data.
